text: Hello! I’m trying to my domain ownership thought HubSpot, and I don’t know if there’s a way to do it without accessing to the DNS.
Hey fam - has anyone successfully gotten chatbot events to report back to Google Tag Manager data layer? I saw multiple posts on this, but haven't been able to find a solution that actually works
Hey Max, I think this would only be possible via ops hub, using a coded action at a certain point in a chatflow to send event data to Google.
hmm... do you happen to know if there is any documentation around this
Not directly, just thinking of how the flow would work in my head (I just wrapped up a custom chatbot/ops hub project so it’s still fresh in my mind)
I think that requires the custom add-on plan

right, in that case you won’t be able to interface with any of the chatbot actions on the client-side because it’s in an iFrame. You _can_ add an event listener for the “blur” event (changing of “focus” between the page itself and the iFramed page) but I’ve found this to be too inconsistent for analytic purposes
thank you. I think we'll see what we can pull out of the default reports from HubSpot
